_aChangeLog.text: Split off a particulary remote part of "Front Yard" near A as "Back"
Improved the T-Apps house entrance crate... bots can still get stuck there if they clutter, unfortunately, but they don't seem to get stuck alone anymore
Added jump connection for the "truck" into "Upstairs" Apartment balcony near B (getting them to access top crate through the back particularly was a problem)
Fixed an issue where a connection went through the fence on T-Spawn and bots would get stuck
Made a bunch of crate tops accessible, mostly on/near bombsites

_aLatestUpdates._sText: What definitely doesn't work yet: Accessing the roof near T-Spawn at all. From the crates near the T-Spawn fence, I can't connect just the edge that you would actually want to jump towards (so tehy always fall down into a gap), from the other crates in "Alley" towards A, I can't connect it at all even though the jump is easier. As a workaround, I marked all the roof tiles as "avoid". :/

_sText:
A nav for the pre-desertification, non-de_cpl_strike-style-B-site source version of Mirage, de_mirage_rc1 (not sure why "rc1"), since oddly, there is none for it.

[state of v1.0]: This is auto generated with some fixes (inaccessible areas, ladders, stairs, oversized areas, that boarded window at B) and place names added, mostly oriented off a 1.6/CZ CSGO-design backport version; some less commonly used things's functionality might still be bad. One particularly dumb crate near T-Apps ("SideHall") has been a real pain, and they still jump oddly there sometimes but it usually seems to work now. I've also seen some inexplicable bot deaths (skull icon) mostly on T-side while testing, but that may have been due to crowding (as I tested 15vs15 just in hopes somebody of them would go certain places)?

"Truck" and "Dumpster" might be a bit contrived since they refer to things that are just crates in this version, and I've put "Kitchen" into the actual kitchen, not "Market" which is neither really a market (nor a kitchen) either but had that name before.
